intro: Hieracium pusillifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It has basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium pusillifolium is often found in open habitats and is considered a common weed in some regions.
